title: I think warlords bloodlust is flawed as a mastery.
body:
It is one of the only masteries that can be activated without the presence of an enemy champion, (or allied champion, in the case of windspeakers blessing), and the non - interactive minion life steal is toxic for lanes.(yes, I know its gimped against minions, but its still usefull)

And considering there is already so much free life steal in bot lane (2% from vampirism, 3% from dorans blade),it just makes it worse.

It either needs to work on champions only (and be buffed accordingly) or outright reworked into a new mastery that maybe can be used by AD and AP champions.

Just my opinion, your thoughts?

Well you didn't say that so how am I supposed to know?

And it doesn't do that either.  What Warlord's Bloodlust does do is offer players choices.  It gives them the option to improve their sustain at the cost of combat effectiveness.  Sustain that is very poor unless the champion is already close to death from fighting.  It doesn't remove the ability to trade or punish players.  Contrary to what you said, it punishes the player who DOES take it by weakening their ability to trade.  Having the ability to lifesteal from minions isn't a problem either because gaining that 2% lifesteal against minions when the ADC has already lost 50% of their health is not game breaking.

Worse yet, removing it weakens everyone who doesn't work with Fervor as well as others do and effectively buffing both everyone who works well with Fervor and the damage focused, harass or mage supports.  Can you imagine what S6 would have been like if you got your way and buffed the likes of Lucian, Ezreal and Zyra even more with these changes?

Not all champions are the same and they prefer different things.  You have to allow options for them or we really will get a game with no real champion choice for players.

Early game it's for long laning. It keeps you farming on a decent threshold of health if you back it up and slow down for a bit.
It definitely does not help you stay in the lane if the enemy laner is poking you, because you don't have enough damage to sustain.
You just dial things back and play on the back leg and you'll be fine. You'll get to the point where the enemy will need a small all-in to finish you.
